conclusion: Identify the charges and their positions: +q at A and B, -q at C and D.
Electric field due to a point charge is E = kq/r^2.
Distance from charges to the intersection is L/âˆš2.
Calculate electric field from +q at A and B: E_AB = 2kq/L^2.
Calculate electric field from -q at C and D: E_CD = 2kq/L^2.
Direction of electric fields: +q at A towards B and D, +q at B towards A and C, -q at C towards A and B, -q at D towards B and C.
Symmetry and cancellation: fields from +q at A and B cancel along AC, fields from -q at C and D cancel along BD.
Net electric field is zero due to cancellation of fields from opposite charges.
The electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square is 0.
